title: Explicit Call to Finalize()
overview: While the Java Language Specification allows an object&#x27;s finalize() method to be called from outside the finalizer, doing so is usually a bad idea. For example, calling finalize() explicitly means that finalize() will be called more than once: the first time will be the explicit call and the last time will be the call that is made after the object is garbage collected.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation Testing:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Do not make explicit calls to finalize(). Use static analysis tools to spot such instances.::
